Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: I dont think the new 'attack' on monero is a real problem, and XMR is still the best privacy coin.   I definitely wouldnt dump it based on this, especially at the bottom of a bear market.   But of course, Komodo is also great and is cheap currently.  I'd be dumping something else to buy KMD, moneor is one of the few good coins to hold on to.

Author: Alexfrog#1338
Content: Monero + RingCT + BUlletproofs > zkSnarks imo.   Also the Monero dev team and research team is exceptional.  They have historically found and fixed flaws in their own code.     zksnarks is 2nd best imo.  I dont like the zcash dev tax but I am interested in other coins that use the tech which don't have that, so I will check out Pirate.  The dPoW is interesting, though I feel like my main investment in dPoW is to own Komodo.  I'm not convinced it actually completely works and provides bitcoin level security to other coins, though I think its very interesting and might work (and at the very least, its a PoW coin with an extra hurdle required to 51% attack, so its still more secure than some other low hash rate PoW coin.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @Alexfrog both projects have their strengths. The only reason XMR continues to have such strong development is because the majority of devs bought around $2 and have been living off it since. Development relies on it continually going up where zcash doesn't. I'm not saying founder's reward is good, but objectively, it has served it's purpose.
